item.title: If you're interested in the EWG call for proposals, the requirements are here: https://github.com/osmfoundation/ewg_bidding/tree/main/projects/ability-to-mute-other-users

Don't forget! The Engineering Working Group has a new call for proposals for: "adding the ability to mute users on the http://openstreetmap.org website" Details at the link: (scroll to the bottom to read it in Dutch French Spanish Swahili and Arabic) https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/11/18/engineering-working-group-call-for-proposals/

In fact, if you go to this page you'll see that the EWG is looking for new members: here's the process and a list of the current members: https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Engineering_Working_Group#Process_for_new_members

While we're on the topic of the EWG's new call for proposals, you might even want to learn more about the Engineering Working Group itself - so here's a link for that, too. https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Engineering_Working_Group

If you're interested in submitting a proposal, you should also read the Engineering Working Group‚Äôs Project Funding Proposal Framework for a general overview of the process. https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Engineering_Working_Group/Project_Funding_Framework

For more details on the EWG proposal, including requirements and how to apply, please see the EWG Project Funding Repository on Github. (Click on ‚ÄúAbility to mute other users‚Äù under the Projects section) https://github.com/osmfoundation/ewg_bidding

Call for proposals! The Engineering Working Group (EWG) is announcing a call for proposals for the following feature: Adding the ability to mute users on the http://openstreetmap.org website. More details at the link. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/11/18/engineering-working-group-call-for-proposals/

RT @GIScienceHD@twitter.com #30DayMapChallenge Day 14: Hexagons For today's entry, our fantastic world mapper @mrizwan1khan@twitter.com charts the growth in number of buildings in #OSM using ohsomeHeX. Just look at that progress! #Map #Geography #Building #OpenStreetMap üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/GIScienceHD/status/1592143138449391616

It's Saturday, November 12, which means the LCCC 2022 meeting is today. It is NOT TOO LATE to register and join (unless you're reading this tweet after 13:00 UTC, in which case, you can watch the recording!) https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/Local_Chapters/Local_Chapters_Congress/2022

What are you doing this weekend? Obviously the answer is going to the LCCC 2022! November 12 13:00-16:00 UTC Register here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1XpwWK9TUd36noT3DJ-7rMxaDE6eBod9FHcCHBesCYYI/viewform?edit_requested=true Program features: @MaggieMaps@twitter.com, @crowd2map@twitter.com @angocam@twitter.com, OSM Colombia, Tanzania and Italy, and ALL OF YOU

Which is why the LCCWG is hosting a virtual meeting on Saturday (Nov. 12) for OSM members & leaders to gather and connect. It's the Local Chapters and Communities Congress 2022 and you could think of it as a mini #SOTM. https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/Local_Chapters/Local_Chapters_Congress/2022

So . . . what is the LCCWG you may be asking? It is the OSM Working Group charged with finding ways for the Foundation to support the growth of local communities, including (but not limited to!) encouraging them to affiliate as Local Chapters. https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Local_Chapters_and_Communities_Working_Group

The Nov 12 LCCC program includes @maggiemaps@twitter.com, the LCCWG, Janet Chapman + @crowd2map@twitter.com Tanzania, @angoca@twitter.com + #osmnotes + OSM Colombia. And ALL OF YOU. You should definitely register ASAP: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/Local_Chapters/Local_Chapters_Congress/2022

Calling all OSM users and community members! Join us Nov. 12 at the LCCC meeting. This global gathering is hosted by the LCCWG--so maybe you're wondering, What is this alphabet soup? Learn more and register here: http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundatio‚Ä¶

We're excited, too! #wikiconferenceNA @OpenStreetMapUS@twitter.com https://twitter.com/OpenStreetMapUS/status/1590070679302733824 RT @OpenStreetMapUS@twitter.com üì£ We're so excited ü•≥ https://twitter.com/WikiConNA/status/1590039642904334336 üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/OpenStreetMapUS/status/1590070679302733824

RT @hotosm@twitter.com After leading the organization for seven years, HOT‚Äôs Executive Director, Tyler Radford, has announced his decision to step down at the end of 2022. https://www.hotosm.org/updates/hots-executive-director-transition/ üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/hotosm/status/1590071700678676483
Sorry about leaving off the third C up there. :)

You can learn more about the LCCC HERE: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/Local_Chapters/Local_Chapters_Congress/2022 And you can (and should!) register at the event page: Date: Nov 12: Time: 13:00 to 16:00 UTC Details: http://osmcal.org/event/1630/

So what is the LCC? It's a virtual event in which members of various OSM communities, whether they are officially recognized Local Chapters of the OSMF or just a regular group of OSM mappers, come together to share stories and learn from each other. https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/Local_Chapters/Local_Chapters_Congress/2022

The Local Chapters and Communities Congress (LCCC 2022) is where OSM members and leaders come together - so mark your calendars for our upcoming meeting: Date: Nov 12: Time: 13:00 to 16:00 UTC Details: https://osmcal.org/event/1630/
